__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row background to a green color by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been worked on.

=== Tagging Bugs ===

If the syslog file is available in the bug report, please look for the kernel driver and use the name as a tag, example:

* driver-madwifi
* driver-ndiswrapper

Also add a tag based on the encryption method, example:

* encryption-wpa
* encryption-wep
* encryption-wpa2

If the bug is related to one of the VPN modules (vpnc,openvpn or pptp), please tag the bug as "vpn".

=== Metabugs ===
<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/network-manager/+bug/145683|Bug 145683]]</nowiki> is about network-manager crashing when connecting to a WPA network on Gutsy Gibbon.  There is a currently a package available in gutsy-proposed for testing.  If you see a related bug please ask people to test the -proposed package.

=== 107 bugs about network-manager in status "New" ===
These bugs are brand new! and have yet to be commented on by anyone.  You can be the first and we have some suggestions for courses of action below.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ask the reporter for '/var/log/syslog' after reproducing the bug and set the bug to "Incomplete"  '''or'''
* If '/var/log/syslog' is present change the status to "Confirmed" and set an importance (if you are not a QA member ask someone for help) '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found)

* Mark the bug as "Invalid" and indicate that it is invalid because it is lacking necessary information '''or'''
* Change the bug's status to "Confirmed" if the reporter replied with the requested information '''or'''
